package.name: cogency
package.docstring: Cogency - A framework for building intelligent agents.

agent.name: agent
agent.docstring: Main Agent class - cognitive orchestration with streaming, memory, and tool integration.

classes.name: Agent
classes.docstring: Cognitive agent with streaming execution, tool integration, memory and adaptive reasoning

methods.name: run
methods.docstring: Run agent and return complete response as string (async)

methods.name: stream
methods.docstring: Stream agent execution

methods.name: traces
methods.docstring: Get detailed execution traces from last run (debug mode only)

classes.docstring: Base class for embedding providers

methods.docstring: Embed text(s) - handles both single strings and lists

methods.docstring: Embed texts and return as 2D numpy array

methods.docstring: Embed single text - convenience method for memory stores

classes.name: Formatter

methods.name: format
methods.docstring: Format notification. Returns None for silent mode (base class).

classes.name: LLM
classes.docstring:
Base class for all LLM implementations in the cogency framework.

All LLM providers support:
- Streaming execution for real-time output
- Automatic key rotation for high-volume usage
- Rate limiting via yield_interval parameter
- Unified interface across providers
- Dynamic model/parameter configuration

methods.name: next_key
methods.docstring: Get next API key - rotates automatically on every call.

methods.name: run
methods.docstring:
Generate a response from the LLM given a list of messages.

Args:
    messages: List of message dictionaries with 'role' and 'content' keys
    **kwargs: Additional parameters for the LLM call

Returns:
    Result containing string response from the LLM or error

methods.name: stream
methods.docstring:
Generate a streaming response from the LLM given a list of messages.

Args:
    messages: List of message dictionaries with 'role' and 'content' keys
    yield_interval: Minimum time between yields for rate limiting (seconds)
    **kwargs: Additional parameters for the LLM call

Returns:
    AsyncIterator[str] for streaming response

classes.init_signature: (self, provider_name: str, api_keys: Union[str, List[str]] = None, model: str = None, timeout: float = 15.0, temperature: float = 0.7, max_tokens: int = 16384, max_retries: int = 3, enable_cache: bool = True, **kwargs)

classes.name: Tool
classes.docstring:
Base class for all tools in the cogency framework.

Standardized tool interface requiring:
- name, description, emoji: Tool identification
- schema, examples, rules: LLM guidance (strings/lists in init)
- run(): Core execution logic
- format(): Display formatting for params and results

methods.name: execute
methods.docstring: Execute tool with automatic validation and error handling - USE THIS, NOT run() directly.

methods.name: format_agent
methods.docstring: Format tool results for agent action history with auto-generation.

methods.name: format_human
methods.docstring: Format tool execution for human display with auto-generation.
methods.signature: (self, params: Dict[str, Any], results: Optional[resilient_result.result.Result] = None) -> tuple[str, str]

methods.name: run
methods.docstring:
Execute the tool with the given parameters.

Returns:
    Dict containing the tool's results or error information

classes.name: Anthropic
classes.docstring:
Base class for all LLM implementations in the cogency framework.

All LLM providers support:
- Streaming execution for real-time output
- Automatic key rotation for high-volume usage
- Rate limiting via yield_interval parameter
- Unified interface across providers
- Dynamic model/parameter configuration

methods.name: next_key
methods.docstring: Get next API key - rotates automatically on every call.

methods.name: run
methods.docstring:
Generate a response from the LLM given a list of messages.

Args:
    messages: List of message dictionaries with 'role' and 'content' keys
    **kwargs: Additional parameters for the LLM call

Returns:
    Result containing string response from the LLM or error

methods.name: stream
methods.docstring:
Generate a streaming response from the LLM given a list of messages.

Args:
    messages: List of message dictionaries with 'role' and 'content' keys
    yield_interval: Minimum time between yields for rate limiting (seconds)
    **kwargs: Additional parameters for the LLM call

Returns:
    AsyncIterator[str] for streaming response

methods.docstring: Embed texts and return as 2D numpy array

methods.name: embed_text
methods.docstring: Embed single text - convenience method for memory stores

functions.name: detect_provider
functions.docstring:
Generic provider detection based on available API keys.

Args:
    providers: Dict mapping provider names to their env key prefixes
              e.g. {"openai": "OPENAI", "anthropic": "ANTHROPIC"}
    fallback: Default provider if no keys detected

Returns:
    Provider name with available keys, or fallback
functions.signature: (providers: Dict[str, str], fallback: Optional[str] = None) -> str

methods.name: run
methods.docstring:
Execute HTTP request using dispatch pattern.
Args:
    url: Target URL for the request
    method: HTTP method (get, post, put, delete, patch)
    headers: Optional HTTP headers dict
    body: Optional request body as string
    json_data: Optional JSON data (automatically sets content-type)
    auth: Optional auth dict with 'type' and credentials
    timeout: Request timeout in seconds (default: 30)
Returns:
    Response data including status, headers, and body
methods.signature: (self, url: str, method: str = 'get', headers: Optional[Dict] = None, body: Optional[str] = None, json_data: Optional[Dict] = None, auth: Optional[Dict] = None, timeout: int = 30, **kwargs) -> Dict[str, Any]

functions.name: detect_provider
functions.docstring:
Generic provider detection based on available API keys.

Args:
    providers: Dict mapping provider names to their env key prefixes
              e.g. {"openai": "OPENAI", "anthropic": "ANTHROPIC"}
    fallback: Default provider if no keys detected

Returns:
    Provider name with available keys, or fallback
functions.signature: (providers: Dict[str, str], fallback: Optional[str] = None) -> str

likely don't need deep reasoning cycles.

functions.name: parse_json
functions.docstring:
Extract JSON from LLM response - clean Result pattern.

Handles:
- Markdown code fences (```json and ```)
- Proper brace matching for JSON objects
- Regex-based pattern extraction for common failure modes
- Graceful Result.fail() on errors

Args:
    response: Raw LLM response string

Returns:
    Result.ok(data) or Result.fail(error)
functions.signature: (response: str, trace_fn: Optional[Callable[[str], NoneType]] = None) -> resilient_result.result.Result

functions.name: parse_json_with_correction
functions.docstring: Parse JSON with self-correction loop for malformed responses.
functions.signature: (response: str, llm_fn: Optional[Callable] = None, trace_fn: Optional[Callable[[str], NoneType]] = None, max_attempts: int = 2) -> resilient_result.result.Result
